title: High Adequacy of Social Safety Net Programs
description: In 2015, Gambia's social safety net programs accounted for 55.15% of the total welfare of beneficiary households, indicating a strong support system for its citizens.

title: Extensive Child Employment in Agriculture
description: In 2015, 94.65% of economically active children aged 7-14 in Gambia were employed in agriculture, highlighting a significant reliance on child labor in this sector.

title: High Percentage of Unpaid Child Family Workers
description: In 2015, 94.62% of children in employment aged 7-14 were unpaid family workers, reflecting a prevalent issue of unpaid child labor in Gambia.

title: Significant Merchandise Exports Outside Region
description: By 2023, 97.38% of Gambia's merchandise exports were directed to low- and middle-income economies outside its region, showcasing its strong trade connections beyond its immediate geographical area.

title: Major Exports to Europe & Central Asia
description: In 2023, 96.95% of Gambia's merchandise exports were to low- and middle-income economies in Europe & Central Asia, indicating a focused export strategy towards these regions.

title: High Female Child Employment in Agriculture
description: In 2015, 97.29% of economically active female children aged 7-14 were employed in agriculture, pointing to a gender-specific challenge in child labor.

title: High Male Child Employment in Agriculture
description: In 2015, 92.75% of economically active male children aged 7-14 were employed in agriculture, indicating a widespread issue of child labor among boys.

title: Prevalence of Children Working Only
description: In 2015, 56.63% of children in employment aged 7-14 were working only, without attending school, highlighting a significant barrier to education.

title: Low Food Production Index
description: In 2022, Gambia's food production index was recorded at 71.08, indicating a significant challenge in agricultural productivity compared to the 2014-2016 baseline.

title: Minimal Contribution of Communications and Computer Services to Exports
description: In 2023, communications and computer services accounted for only 1.12% of Gambia's service exports, highlighting a limited role in the country's export economy.

title: Limited Digital Public Services for Business Entry
description: As of 2024, Gambia scored 8.33 in the digital public services and transparency of information for business entry, indicating room for improvement in digital infrastructure.

title: Challenges in Business Location Attractiveness
description: Gambia's overall score for business location was 33.42 in 2024, suggesting challenges in attracting businesses to the country.

title: Moderate Labor Market Conditions
description: In 2024, Gambia's labor market scored 49.22, reflecting moderate conditions that could be improved to enhance economic growth.

title: Regulatory Challenges in Utility Services
description: The quality of regulations on utility services in Gambia was rated at 36.46 in 2024, indicating regulatory challenges that need addressing.

title: Limited Social Safety Net Coverage for the Richest Quintile
description: In 2015, only 0.55% of Gambia's richest quintile was covered by social safety net programs, highlighting a gap in social protection.

title: Low Female Child Employment in Manufacturing
description: In 2015, only 0.08% of economically active female children aged 7-14 were employed in manufacturing, indicating minimal child labor in this sector.

title: Prevalence of Child Employment in Services
description: In 2015, 2.71% of economically active children aged 7-14 were employed in services, reflecting a notable presence of child labor in this sector.

title: High Rate of Children in Employment, Study, and Work
description: In 2015, 43.37% of children aged 7-14 were involved in employment, study, and work, indicating a significant portion of the youth balancing multiple roles.

title: Minimal Child Wage Employment
description: In 2015, only 0.85% of children aged 7-14 were employed as wage workers, suggesting limited formal employment opportunities for children.
